title.native: ポケットモンスター サン＆ムーン

description:
After his mom wins a free vacation trip, Satoshi and Pikachu are off on another adventure. This time in the tropical land of Alola. There they meet new friends, Pokémon and explore new islands.
We also get introduced to Z-Rings, a device used for Z-Moves. What kind of mysterious Pokémon and challenges will come their way, and why is Kapu-Kokeko so interested in our young trainer?!

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rica_matsumoto3) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ricachanhouse) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%BE%E6%9C%AC%E6%A2%A8%E9%A6%99) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rika_Matsumoto)

Rika Matsumoto is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer, as well as one of the founders of [JAM Project](https://anilist.co/staff/102041/).

After early stage work, she began both voice acting and singing careers. The most popular role by Rika is [Satoshi](https://anilist.co/character/2473/) (Ash Ketchum in English translations), the main character of the anime series [Pokémon](https://anilist.co/anime/527/). She also had a role in the [Yu-Gi-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/550/) series as [Ryou Bakura](https://anilist.co/character/1488/) and [Yami Bakura](https://anilist.co/character/1489/). As such, Matsumoto has taken on roles for young boys. Matsumoto also performs the songs for many of the openings for the Japanese Pokémon anime.

Matsumoto has had lead or supporting roles in dozens of series. She has also had a radio show in Japan and does some dubbing work for translations of American films and TV series into Japanese. She announced in April 2008 she was taking time off from the group and her solo work.

Her name is also sometimes romanized as Rica Matsumoto.

__[Website](https://okazakitaiiku.com/) | [Profile (Sony Music)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/okazakitaiiku/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/okazaki_taiiku) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/okazaki_taiiku/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/oka.akitoshi?fref=nf) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@okazakitaiiku)__

__Birth Name:__ Akitoshi Oka (岡亮聡)
__Birthplace:__ Nishinomiya City, Hyougo Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Doshisha University (Faculty of Culture and Information Sciences)

__Taiiku Okazaki__, alernatively known as ShitokiaP, is a Japanese voice actor, vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label SME Records (2016–), affiliated with Sony Music Artists (2019–).

[Website](http://www.realgirlsband.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/realofficial_12) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC38Cc0nADTQ_ibeBdnLQ0ZA/featured) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/real.girlsband/)

ЯeaL (りある) is a female Japanese rock band under SME Records. The band was formed in Osaka on December 8, 2012. 

**Members**
Ryoko (vocal, guitar)
Fumiha (bass, chorus)
Aika (drums, chorus)

*Former*
Yurika (guitar, chorus)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/49378668) | [Fanbox (NSFW)](https://fujiishingo.fanbox.cc/posts/3033014)

Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/), where his peers included [Yoshimichi Kameda](https://anilist.co/staff/105635/) and [Shinichi Kurita](https://anilist.co/staff/137119/). He drew analogically for the first two years of his career and then switched to digital. [Yasushi Muraki](https://anilist.co/staff/105090/) calls him a follower of [Souichirou Matsuda](https://anilist.co/staff/141244/), whom Fujii is influenced by.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1189754972) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/bushi2424.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2415493) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takeshi_maenami)

He has gathered a lot of attention with his incredibly dynamic, [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-inspired cuts in [Pokémon Sun & Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/97634/). His animation is characterized by erratic snappy timing, liberal and ample use of smears (often with a complete lack of outlines), and extreme perspectives. 

Graduated Yoyogi Animation School in 2009, but spent much of the following years helping out at his parents' restaurant and didn't start formally working as an animator until 2018. Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shinada_yukari) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24067586) | [Tumblr](https://shinadayukari09.tumblr.com/)

Freelancer.

**Diana Andrea Pérez Revatett** was a Mexican voice actress. She was known for being the Latin American Spanish voide of Jessie in _Pokémon_, Kagura in _Inuyasha_ and Frida Suarez in _El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera_.

Twitter | Instagram **Miguel Ángel Leal Rodríguez** is a Mexican voice actor known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Meliodas in _The Seven Deadly Sins_, Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali in _The Big Bang Theory_ and Logan Reese in _Zoey 101_. He is the recurring voice of Carlos Pena Jr. He's the brother of Lupita Leal and Alfredo Leal Non-Anime Roles: - Josh (Watch Dogs 2) - Markus (Detroit Become Human)

Shinji Miyazaki  is a Japanese composer and arranger. He was born in Kobe, and lived in a variety of areas on the island of Shikoku for much of his childhood. He developed a taste for pop music, which eventually led him to study musical arrangement and piano instruction at the Shobi College of Music. He took some time in deciding that music would become his career, but eventually decided to become an arranger, and later a composer.

His work has dealt primarily with musical scores for anime. His most well known contributions include music for the Crayon Shin-chan series and music for much of the Pokémon anime series and most of the films in it from 1997 to 2019. His work pulls from many inspirations, among them J-Pop and American pop influences, as well as jazz artist Gil Evans. Many of his compositions utilize string and brass instruments, particularly the french horn.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28).

He studied under [Yasukazu Shouji](https://anilist.co/staff/197550/Yasukazu-Shouji) and [Jouji Shimura](https://anilist.co/staff/148629/Jouji-Shimura) during his time at OLM.

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28).

He studied under [Yasukazu Shouji](https://anilist.co/staff/197550/Yasukazu-Shouji) and [Jouji Shimura](https://anilist.co/staff/148629/Jouji-Shimura) during his time at OLM.

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28).

He studied under [Yasukazu Shouji](https://anilist.co/staff/197550/Yasukazu-Shouji) and [Jouji Shimura](https://anilist.co/staff/148629/Jouji-Shimura) during his time at OLM.
Satoshi is the creator of Pocket Monsters and Game Freak company

Ken Sugimori is a Japanese video game designer, illustrator, manga artist, and director. He is most famous as the character designer and art director for the Pokémon franchise. Sugimori is also credited with the art direction for other titles, including Pulseman.  

Sugimori drew all of the original 151 Pokémon himself. He has worked on the various Pokémon movies, trading cards, and other games like the Super Smash Bros. series. From early 1981 until 1986, Sugimori illustrated a gaming fanzine called Game Freak, which had been started by Satoshi Tajiri. Sugimori discovered the magazine in a doujinshi shop, and decided to get involved. Eventually, the two decided to pitch an arcade game design idea to Namco; they reworked Game Freak into a development company and produced Mendel Palace. 

Sugimori is most famous as the character designer and art director for the Pokémon franchise. He has worked on the various Pokémon movies, trading cards, and other games. For Pokémon Black and White, Sugimori directed a team of 17 people in designing new characters for the games, though he always drew the final designs. He drew much of his inspiration from observing animals in aquariums and zoos. 

Sugimori has also written and illustrated original manga, including one which was distributed with pre-orders of Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness. When he begins a new character, his process normally involves making a rough sketch, then tracing it on to film paper while polishing it and making the illustration more professional looking. After that, he draws the character many times, changing its proportions until he is satisfied.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/624583750)
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yonemura_s)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/omodeakemi)

**Education:** Yoyogi Animation Academy

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/junichifujisaku)

Junichi Fujisaku is a Japanese director, animation director, scriptwriter, game producer and novelist. He's affiliated with studio Production I.G.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/624583750)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojikimo)

Originating from Studio One Pack. Currently freelance.

Worked as a production assistant before starting as an animator in 2017.
